column4: Question, is wlan connection different (pc to pc) than normal wlan?
what do you mean by normal wlan?
wlan from a more common router... ex. dlink...
we have a project in the city where you can log onto the city wlan but when I open network manager... it sees it as a little computer  and i can not connect..
hmmm
not as my home wlan... and as the other wlans here in the complex
if i create a wlan connection from my computer.. it also sees it as pc to pc..
yeah
well I mean, it is a computer to computer connection
and i can not connect to such a connection made by a friend from a mac eather... but he can connect to one I make?
that is most likely just a firewall setting on his end
any ideas? maby it needs something... verification? or being able to open a webpage?
you only have problems with ad hoc networks, not infrastructure right?
yes with no key... have not tried to disable my home wlan key yet
wait your home wlan is operating as ad hoc?
no it has a key or am i not understanding you
well ad hoc and infrastructure can all use keys
but most home networks use infrastructure
so i must have infrastructure... how can i find out? iwconfig?
connect to your router
sorry i cant help you much I dunno
thanks anyway...
